item.title: Newsbrief: Devcom to rebrand as Gamescom Dev
item.content:encoded:
Chris Kerr, Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

August 21, 2025

1 Min Read

Image via Gamescom / Devcom

Newsbrief: Devcom, the developer-focused conference that takes place in Cologne the same week as Gamescom, is being renamed to better integrate it into the Gamescom brand. 

Starting in October 2025, the event will be rebranded as 'Gamescom Dev.' "Felix Falk, managing director of game—The German Games Industry Association and co-organizer of gamescom, said the new moniker better reflects Devcom's position as a "key pillar of the Gamescom family."

"The devcom developer conference has rapidly grown into one of the world’s most important events for game developers," he explained. "It has become a key pillar of the Gamescom family. By renaming it Gamescom Dev, we aim to create greater synergies with the other Gamescom formats and tap into new opportunities through closer integration with the Gamescom brand world. This will take our success story to the next level."

The full press release can be accessed on the Gamescom website. 

Game Developer attended Gamescom 2025 via the Gamescom Media Ambassador Program, which covered flights and accommodation.

About the Author

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Game Developer news editor Chris Kerr is an award-winning journalist and reporter with over a decade of experience in the game industry. His byline has appeared in notable print and digital publications including Edge, Stuff, Wireframe, International Business Times, and PocketGamer.biz. Throughout his career, Chris has covered major industry events including GDC, PAX Australia, Gamescom, Paris Games Week, and Develop Brighton. He has featured on the judging panel at The Develop Star Awards on multiple occasions and appeared on BBC Radio 5 Live to discuss breaking news.
